question.title: How to overlay an image with text that has a background with rounded corners
question.content: The issue is that the text is overlaying a div with a background image. If there wasn't an image in the outer div and a solid colour, I can imagine that I'd be able to do this fairly easily with a few small html elements with rounded corners placed in the correct places, however the background image is what adds the complexity.

content.content: you need to add :before and :after to the .innertext element. UPDATE: to have multiple lines, just add a flex-direction: column container, and every line will have the :after (right) corner, and only the first child will have the :before (top) corner
I will reuse the same idea I used in a previous answer where I considered and SVG filter to create the rounded corners.

This adds a few pseudo elements to the text that create the shapes around the text. I had to modify the HTML a bit to accommodate these pseudo elements; was not sure if that was okay. Try this out and see if it works in all your required browsers.
